    • Method Detail

      • enqueue

        public void enqueue(android.location.Location location)
        Adds a location to the location queue. If the location causes the batch size to be exceeded, this will trigger the locations to be flushed from the location queue into a batch request which will eventually be sent to the location service.
        Parameters:
        location - - Location reported by the Android OS.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Stops the publisher from publishing. Should be used when terminating the object.

      • pendingPositionUpdates

        public int pendingPositionUpdates()
        Checks the number of position updates waiting to be batched.
        Returns:
        Number of position updates in the position queue.

      • pendingBatches

        public int pendingBatches()
        Checks the number of batches waiting to be sent to the location service.
        Returns:
        Number of pending batches.

      • forceFlush

        public void forceFlush()
        Force pending locations in the location queue to be batched and sent to the location service. This method should only be invoked in the event that a final flush of locations needs to be performed (During a shutdown for example)
